Yes, Vikings did wear jewelry and accessories as a way to decorate their clothing and signify their status. Wealthy men and women would often wear brooches, necklaces, rings, and bracelets made from precious metals, such as gold and silver. These pieces would often be intricately crafted with designs that incorporated symbols from Norse mythology, such as Thor's hammer or Odin's knot.

Another common accessory worn by both men and women was the belt. These belts often had elaborate buckles that were also decorated with symbols and designs.

Additionally, Vikings also adorned their clothing and accessories with fur, feathers, and bone. These decorative items would often be from animals that were important in Viking culture, such as bears, wolves, and birds of prey. 

Overall, jewelry and accessories were an important part of Viking culture and were used to showcase wealth, power, and identity.
